intro: Marrubium astracanicum subsp. macrodon, commonly known as the Astracan mountain horehound, is a perennial herb native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and purple or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing adaptations to arid environments. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional remedies. The subspecies macrodon is distinguished by its larger, more robust flowers compared to other members of the species.
